item.title: Becky add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "...and with a burning pain in my heart I realized how unnecessary, how petty, and how deceptive all that had hindered us from loving was. I understood that when you love you must either, in your reasonings about that love, start from what is highest, from what is more important than happiness or unhappiness, sin or virtue in their accepted meaning, or you must not reason at all." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Becky add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Becky add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Becky add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Becky add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Art is the proper task of life. " -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Becky add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Becky add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, â€œLook, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Becky add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Nothing thicker than a knife's blade separates happiness from melancholy." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Becky add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book known to him by heart and his friends can only read the title." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Becky add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "What is the meaning of life? That was all- a simple question; one that tended to close in on one with years, the great revelation had never come. The great revelation perhaps never did come. Instead, there were little daily miracles, illuminations, matches struck unexpectedly in the dark; here was one." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Becky add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Literature is strewn with the wreckage of those who have minded beyond reason the opinion of others." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Becky add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Becky add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Patriotism is the last refuge of a scoundrel." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Becky add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "My dear friend, clear your mind of cant [excessive thought]. You may <i>talk</i> as other people do: you may say to a man, "Sir, I am your most humble servant." You are not his most humble servant. You may say, "These are bad times; it is a melancholy thing to be reserved to such times." You don't mind the times ... You may <i>talk</i> in this manner; it is a mode of talking in Society; but don't <i>think</i> foolishly." -- Samuel Johnson
